text: Owen Hannaway (8 October 1939 - 21 January 2006) was a Scottish historian. == Life == He was born on 8 October 1939 in Glasgow, and educated at St Aloysius' College and Glasgow University. He died in 2006. == Career == He completed his PhD in Chemistry in 1965 at the University of Glasgow. == Distinctions == He was an Edelstein International Fellow. He received the Derek Price/Rod Webster Prize. He has also received the Dexter Award. ==Selected publications== ===Articles=== * (See Andreas Libavius and Tycho Brahe.) * (See Ira Remsen.) ===Books=== * The Chemists And The Word: The Didactic Origins Of Chemistry (1975) == References == Category:Scottish historians Category:1939 births Category:2006 deaths Category:People from Glasgow Category:People educated at St Aloysius' College, Glasgow Category:Alumni of the University of Glasgow Category:Academics of the University of Glasgow Category:Historians of science Category:Scottish emigrants to the United States Category:20th-century historians
